WorkItem.Description:
step by step what i do:
1) loading the saved xml (attached).
2) Go to Tools
3) Click Edit Gemming Templates
4) Tick Rare(purified), Rare(royal), Rare (glowing), Rare(jewelcrafting)
5) Click Ok
6) Tools -> Optimize -> Calculation to Optimize: Dps Rating -> Optimize
7) After getting a warnign for too many gems and waist items, i click okay.
WorkItem.Summary: Stuck while Optimizing with Mage Model.

Comments.Message:
Useful PS: When i unticked Rare(royal) and ticked the other 3 rare setups (see over), Optimizer worked normally, then, when i unticked Rare(jewelcrafting) and ticked the other 3 rare setups, Optimizer worked normally again.

so what i think is Rare(royal) and Rare(jewelcrafting) somehow dont work at the same time.

I'm also getting this "stuck when optimizing" problem, but the results are inconsistent (I can't reliably reproduce them).

I have only Rare(purified) checked in the gemming templates, and then runed dragon's, runed scarlet, reckless, veiled, and potent monarch, and purified twilight opals are checked as available to the optimizer.

Sometimes the optimizer will get stuck, and sometimes it will not.  I can't figure out a way to reproduce it 100% of the time though.
Mage optimizer freezes up on me too. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesnt. When it does not, the program must be shut down through task manager.

I've also seen weird optimizer endless loops in Rawr.mage (no progress bar motion, single processor grinding) on this release.   I was also able to make this stop by disabling the Rare(jewelcrafting) template.  Similarly, I also discovered that the optimizer is NOT ready for Runed Dragon's Eye gems to be colored (RED), like patch 3.2 will bring -- really weird stuff starts happening with auto-gem choices.

To go along with what tkb said, I tried setting Runed Dragon's Eye to only fit red sockets, but then the optimizer started putting Reckless Monarch Topazzes into almost all red and yellow sockets, even though Runed Scarlet Ruby was clearly still ahead in points  (Immediately after optimizing I was able to gain about another 40 overall points by simply switching each item to one with a higher-rated gemming.)

Optimizer is working under assumption that dragon's eye gems are prismatic regardless of what you select in item editor. That will be changed for a build that is targeted against patch 3.2.

I'll take a look at the freezing issue.
